instruction: Name three elements of dystopian literature
output: Three common elements of dystopian literature are a future setting, oppressive governments, and a brave hero or heroine challenging the status quo. Dystopian stories typically feature a world that is dysfunctional and oppressive, often with technology or other scientific advances increasing the gap between the powerful few and the weak majority. The hero or heroine of the story is a brave individual who tries to make a stand against the oppressive system.
